titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ruth E. Lewis Scrapbooks
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives
publicationstmt.p: Copyright Â© 2015 The Board of Trustees of the Leland Stanford Junior University. All rights reserved.

note.p: This encoded finding aid is compliant with Stanford EAD Best Practice Guidelines, Version 1.0.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Scrapbooks from her student days at Stanford, volume one, 1905-08, volume two, 1908-10; includes invitations, programs, menus, calling cards, dance cards, greeting cards, clippings, postcards, notes, class registration cards, and photographs. Some items pertain to Lowell High School in San Francisco, where she graduated in 1905, including a photograph of the girls basketball team. Other photographs include beach scenes, groups of women students at Stanford, student outings, football games 1905-06, Encina Club members, 1906, and the men of the Class of 1907, taken in 1905. Volume one also includes a Stanford University transcript for William Henry Tucker.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

acqinfo.p: Gift of the estate of Ruth Lewis Tucker, 1993.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Ruth E. Lewis Scrapbooks (SC0463). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Ruth E. Lewis earned her a.b. in Greek from Stanford University in May 1909. She married William Henry Tucker, class of 1908, in 1910.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Scrapbooks from her student days at Stanford, volume one, 1905-08, volume two, 1908-10; includes invitations, programs, menus, calling cards, dance cards, greeting cards, clippings, postcards, notes, class registration cards, and photographs. Some items pertain to Lowell High School in San Francisco, where she graduated in 1905, including a photograph of the girls basketball team. Other photographs include beach scenes, groups of women students at Stanford, student outings, football games 1905-06, Encina Club members, 1906, and the men of the Class of 1907, taken in 1905. Volume one also includes a Stanford University transcript for William Henry Tucker.
